mdRecord.dcterms:title: Rough Memorandum account of Lawrence Lewis, 1837-1839
mdRecord.dcterms:description: For hauling sarcophagus to Mount Vernon, paid hire of hack for Struthers and workmen to Mount Vernon to put up the same; clothing for Gabriel, "ditto for 1839 to 9th June when he died deduct his meal 7 bushels from his usual allowance to him for the half year", for coffin and digging grave, etc., with amounts given. Fragment. [See reverse for letter to Lewis from M. Snyder, dated 31 Dec. 1838, asking for taxes due on house]. Autograph document, 2 pages.
